0,Industrial_Gas_Turbines_AMY_Razak.txt,167,e9a2b12f5bb5314039adf8248593ab42fba8ebe33cf9fec8a0ecd0a9bffa508c,"10.10.

Such a strategy for VIGV control is suitable when the EGT set point for VIGV control is below the maximum EGT limit. It is normally employed primarily to reduce gas turbine starting power requirements for single-shaft gas turbines. Since the EGT set point for operating the VIGV is below the maximum EGT limit, the VIGV will be fully opened for most of the useful.
10.10 Control system strategy for VIGV control applied to a single-shaft gas turbine (EGT = exhaust gas temperature).
# Engine control systems and transient performance

power output range of the gas turbine. Another strategy for controlling the VIGV is to maintain the EGT at the maximum or limiting value for reduced power outputs. If the above control strategy is attempted, an increase in power demand from the gas turbine will result in the EGT limit being reached before the VIGV is fully open. Thus the maximum power output from the gas turbine cannot be achieved. An open loop response may be incorporated into the control system of the VIGV to rectify this problem. The open loop response may be such that the VIGV is opened fully for a fixed time period when an increase in power demand is required. Provided this time period is sufficiently large, the desired power output from the gas turbine can be achieved. After the elapse of this time period, the control switches to close loop control so that the VIGV closes to maintain the EGT on its limit.

Inclusion of the open loop response resolves the difficulty of maintaining the power demand from the gas turbine at constant EGT operation, when such a control system is used in DLE engines, in the period when the VIGV is fully opened (open loop) the fuel–air ratio may exceed the lower extinction limit. This results in flameout and tripping of the engine. A better control strategy, in this instance, is to modulate the VIGV to maintain the power demand and to modulate the fuel valve to maintain the EGT on the required limit. By employing such a control strategy, the open loop response described above can be eliminated. ",What is the primary purpose of using a VIGV control strategy with an EGT set point below the maximum limit in single-shaft gas turbines?,To reduce gas turbine starting power requirements.,The main goal is lowering the power needed to start single-shaft gas turbines.,"Primarily, it's employed for decreasing the starting power demands of the turbine.",Its chief use is in minimizing the initial power requirements for turbine startup.,The strategy is mainly applied to cut down on the power necessary during the starting phase of single-shaft gas turbines.

",What happens to the VIGV when the EGT set point for its operation is below the maximum EGT limit?,The VIGV will be fully opened for most of the useful power output range.,"For the majority of the operational range, the VIGV remains completely open.",It stays fully open across most of the turbine's effective power output spectrum.,"During most operational periods, the VIGV is in a fully opened position.",The VIGV is designed to be entirely open throughout the main power output phases.

",How can an open loop response in the VIGV control system help achieve the desired power output?,"By fully opening the VIGV for a fixed time period when an increase in power demand is required, then switching to closed loop control.",It temporarily opens the VIGV completely to meet power demands before reverting to closed loop for EGT control.,"The strategy involves a timed full opening of the VIGV for power increase, followed by closed loop operation.","An initial open loop phase fully opens the VIGV to boost power, then switches to closed loop to maintain EGT.","Through a temporary full opening of the VIGV in response to power demand, ensuring desired output before controlling EGT."

",What is a better control strategy for DLE engines to avoid flameout?,"Modulate the VIGV to maintain power demand and the fuel valve to keep EGT at the required limit, eliminating the need for open loop response.",Adjusting the VIGV for power and the fuel valve for EGT control avoids the risks of open loop operation.,A dual modulation approach for VIGV and fuel valve ensures power and EGT limits are met without open loop.,"By controlling VIGV and fuel valve separately for power and EGT, the open loop phase can be omitted.","Simultaneous modulation of VIGV and fuel valve addresses power needs and EGT limits, removing open loop necessity."

",Why is the EGT set point for VIGV control kept below the maximum EGT limit?,To ensure the VIGV can be fully opened for most of the gas turbine's useful power output range.,Keeping it below the max allows the VIGV to remain open across the main operational power spectrum.,This setting permits the VIGV to stay fully open during the turbine's primary power production phases.,It enables the VIGV to operate in a fully opened state for the majority of the power output range.,The below-limit EGT set point ensures the VIGV's full opening capability throughout most power outputs.

",What is the role of the low signal select in the control system strategy for VIGV control?,It helps in selecting the lower of the input signals to control the VIGV actuator effectively.,The low signal select ensures the VIGV actuator responds to the least of the control inputs.,"By choosing the minimum input signal, it aids in precise VIGV actuator control.",It functions to pick the smallest control signal for accurate VIGV positioning.,The mechanism selects the lowest input to guide the VIGV actuator's operation optimally.

",How does modulating the VIGV and fuel valve separately improve control in DLE engines?,"It allows for maintaining power demand through the VIGV and EGT limits via the fuel valve, avoiding flameout risks.","Separate modulation ensures power needs are met by the VIGV while the fuel valve keeps EGT in check, preventing flameout.","This approach independently adjusts power (VIGV) and temperature (fuel valve), eliminating the need for risky open loop phases.","By controlling power and EGT separately, it removes the hazard of exceeding the fuel–air extinction limit.","Dual modulation addresses power and temperature requirements individually, safeguarding against engine flameout."
